page.title: 15Rochford's Garden Centre
page.content:
The name of Rochfords has been well known in the area for the past four generations. Today the family run a garden and landscape centre on a six acre site in Turnford.
The firm employs twenty-four staff to deal with the seven to eight hundred people who visit the centre each week. The most popular selling plant is the African Violet and the oldest plant is the Cycad which is a plant that dates back to the times of the dinosaurs.
The plants are looked after by experts and some thousands of gallons of water a day are needed to keep the plants in good condition.
